pros: Working Chance is a great place to work. Working with clients is a real highlight. The work the charity does is important and everyone at the charity is passionate about what they do. Charity is considerate of everyone and it’s a place where opinions and contributions are welcome. I enjoyed my time at Working Chance and learned a lot from working there.
cons: The charity is small so there isn’t a lot of room for progression. There is an emphasis on CPD and external training is provided.
It’s a very toxic environment. It’s clicky. There are clear favourites. The list is endless….

pros: Accessible location supervision regular brilliant clients

pros: It was a fantastic environment to work. Surround by lovely colleagues supporting people back into employment. I met many good people at Working Chance and was fortunate enough that my time straddled the tenure of both the Founder and CEO and the incoming and present CEO. Both remarkable people.
cons: The support required from some (but not all) of the service users could be a little overwhelming at times.

review_title: The changes are not enough hostile environment
pros: The pros are the clients that generally think they will get help
cons: It is still a hostile environment and new staff changes are not for the better. From changes at the top to middle management.  There are no workplace boundaries and this reflects with management decision.  The clients dont get the help they need with many complex issues.   The top management are not approachable and relationships  between top and middle management is confusing.  Many complaints internally about Confidential issues which dont get resolved.

review_title: Great Potential, Management in serious need of an overhaul..
pros:
Working with extreamly talented individuals who genuinely want to make their own and their famillies lives better.
Good mix of experience within the team
cons:
Leadership - Tends to make decisions with little or no forward planning, shoot first and ask questions later. There is a typical set up of one good cop, one mad cop and one bad cop. SMT have little or no vested interest it would seem in employee satisfaction and given that up until recently had an accountant running HR, have little or no understanding of employee relations. 

The office culture - Not a place for the quiet, if you want to be noticed, it seems the only way to do so is to belittle junior members of the team. 

Promotions - see above, those who are loud in opinion and side with management, will do extreamely well...
